Templates.helpDescription: Contains N sections which act as containers for any library controls
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Accordion

Templates.helpDescription: Represents a panel which is a container for other controls. The container does not have any layout function.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.AccordionSection

Templates.helpDescription: The application header control stands on the top of any application page. It consists basically of 4 areas. Logo area/Function area provided by application/Search area/Logout area
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.ApplicationHeader

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.Area({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	shape: undefined, // string
	coords: undefined, // string
	href: undefined, // sap.ui.core.URI
	alt: undefined // string
})
Templates.helpDescription: Used for defining areas in an image map. At runtime, the user can trigger an action, or start a URL, from the single image areas.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Area

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.AutoComplete({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	value: "", // string
	textDirection: sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit, // sap.ui.core.TextDirection
	enabled: true, // boolean
	editable: true, // boolean
	required: false, // boolean
	width: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	maxLength: 0, // int
	valueState: sap.ui.core.ValueState.None, // sap.ui.core.ValueState
	textAlign: sap.ui.core.TextAlign.Begin, // sap.ui.core.TextAlign
	imeMode: sap.ui.core.ImeMode.Auto, // sap.ui.core.ImeMode
	design: sap.ui.core.Design.Standard, // sap.ui.core.Design
	helpId: "", // string
	accessibleRole: sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole.Textbox, // sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole
	name: undefined, // string
	placeholder: undefined, // string, since 1.14.0
	maxPopupItems: 10, // int
	displaySecondaryValues: false, // boolean
	selectedKey: undefined, // string
	selectedItemId: undefined, // string
	enableScrolling: true, // boolean
	items: [], // sap.ui.core.ListItem
	myListBox: "", // sap.ui.commons.ListBox
	ariaDescribedBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	ariaLabelledBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	listBox: "", // sap.ui.commons.ListBox
	change: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this],
	liveChange: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this],
	suggest: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this]
})
Templates.helpDescription: Textfield with list based text completion.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.AutoComplete

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.Button({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	text: "", // string
	enabled: true, // boolean
	width: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	helpId: "", // string
	icon: "", // sap.ui.core.URI
	iconHovered: "", // sap.ui.core.URI
	iconSelected: "", // sap.ui.core.URI
	iconFirst: true, // boolean
	height: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	styled: true, // boolean
	lite: false, // boolean
	style: sap.ui.commons.ButtonStyle.Default, // sap.ui.commons.ButtonStyle
	ariaDescribedBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	ariaLabelledBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	press: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this]
})
Templates.helpDescription: Enables users to trigger actions such as save or print. For the button UI, you can define some text or an icon, or both.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Button

Templates.helpDescription: Callout is a small popup with some useful information and links that is shown when a mouse is hovered over a specific view element.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Callout

Templates.helpDescription: CalloutBase is a building block for Callout. Do not use it directly. Use the Callout control instead
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.Carousel({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	orientation: sap.ui.commons.enums.Orientation.horizontal, // sap.ui.commons.enums.Orientation
	width: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	height: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	defaultItemHeight: 150, // int
	defaultItemWidth: 150, // int
	animationDuration: 500, // int
	visibleItems: undefined, // int
	handleSize: 22, // int
	firstVisibleIndex: 0, // int, since 1.11.0
	content: [] // sap.ui.core.Control
})
Templates.helpDescription: Carousel holds multiple controls and displays them vertical or horizontal next to each other. You can define how many content items should be displayed at once or let the carousel determine that for you. Navigation is done through buttons or keys.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Carousel

Templates.helpDescription: Provides a box which can be flagged, the box has a label. A check box can either stand alone, or in a group with other check boxes. As an option, the boxes can initially be set to status 'Not Editable'.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.CheckBox

Templates.helpDescription: This control gives the user the opportunity to choose a color. The color can be defined using HEX-, RGB- or HSV-values or a CSS colorname.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.ColorPicker

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.ComboBox({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	value: "", // string
	textDirection: sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit, // sap.ui.core.TextDirection
	enabled: true, // boolean
	editable: true, // boolean
	required: false, // boolean
	width: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	maxLength: 0, // int
	valueState: sap.ui.core.ValueState.None, // sap.ui.core.ValueState
	textAlign: sap.ui.core.TextAlign.Begin, // sap.ui.core.TextAlign
	imeMode: sap.ui.core.ImeMode.Auto, // sap.ui.core.ImeMode
	design: sap.ui.core.Design.Standard, // sap.ui.core.Design
	helpId: "", // string
	accessibleRole: sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole.Textbox, // sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole
	name: undefined, // string
	placeholder: undefined, // string, since 1.14.0
	maxPopupItems: 10, // int
	displaySecondaryValues: false, // boolean
	selectedKey: undefined, // string
	selectedItemId: undefined, // string
	items: [], // sap.ui.core.ListItem
	myListBox: "", // sap.ui.commons.ListBox
	ariaDescribedBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	ariaLabelledBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	listBox: "", // sap.ui.commons.ListBox
	change: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this],
	liveChange: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this]
})
Templates.helpDescription: The control provides a field that allows end users to either enter some text, or to choose an entry out of a list of pre-defined items. The choosable items can be provided in the form of a complete ListBox, single ListItems.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.ComboBox

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.DatePicker({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	value: "", // string
	textDirection: sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit, // sap.ui.core.TextDirection
	enabled: true, // boolean
	editable: true, // boolean
	required: false, // boolean
	width: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	maxLength: 0, // int
	valueState: sap.ui.core.ValueState.None, // sap.ui.core.ValueState
	textAlign: sap.ui.core.TextAlign.Begin, // sap.ui.core.TextAlign
	imeMode: sap.ui.core.ImeMode.Auto, // sap.ui.core.ImeMode
	design: sap.ui.core.Design.Standard, // sap.ui.core.Design
	helpId: "", // string
	accessibleRole: sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole.Textbox, // sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole
	name: undefined, // string
	placeholder: undefined, // string, since 1.14.0
	locale: undefined, // string
	yyyymmdd: undefined, // string
	ariaDescribedBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	ariaLabelledBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	change: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this],
	liveChange: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this]
})
Templates.helpDescription:
Allows end users to interact with dates.
Entries can directly be written in, or selected from a calendar pad.
Note: Dates can always be manually entered in the fix YYYYMMDD format, on top of the flexible "locale" format.
If the value is provided via data binding, using a Date.type the formatter of the Date.type is used.
Since version 1.22 the unified.Calendar is used inside the datePicker. So applications using the DatePicker should load the unified library. Otherwise it will be loaded the first time a DatePicker is opened.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.DatePicker

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.Dialog({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	width: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	height: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	scrollLeft: 0, // int
	scrollTop: 0, // int
	title: "", // string
	applyContentPadding: true, // boolean
	showCloseButton: true, // boolean
	resizable: true, // boolean
	minWidth: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	minHeight: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	maxWidth: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	maxHeight: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	contentBorderDesign: sap.ui.commons.enums.BorderDesign.None, // sap.ui.commons.enums.BorderDesign
	modal: false, // boolean
	accessibleRole: sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole.Dialog, // sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole
	keepInWindow: false, // boolean, since 1.9.0
	autoClose: false, // boolean, since 1.10
	buttons: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	content: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	defaultButton: "", // sap.ui.commons.Button
	initialFocus: "", // sap.ui.core.Control
	closed: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this]
})
Templates.helpDescription: An interactive window appearing on request displaying information to the user. The API supports features such as popups with fixed sizes, popups with unlimited width, scrolling bars for large windows, and control nesting (for example, a drop-down list can be included in the window).
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Dialog

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.DropdownBox({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	value: "", // string
	textDirection: sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit, // sap.ui.core.TextDirection
	enabled: true, // boolean
	editable: true, // boolean
	required: false, // boolean
	width: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	maxLength: 0, // int
	valueState: sap.ui.core.ValueState.None, // sap.ui.core.ValueState
	textAlign: sap.ui.core.TextAlign.Begin, // sap.ui.core.TextAlign
	imeMode: sap.ui.core.ImeMode.Auto, // sap.ui.core.ImeMode
	design: sap.ui.core.Design.Standard, // sap.ui.core.Design
	helpId: "", // string
	accessibleRole: sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole.Textbox, // sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole
	name: undefined, // string
	placeholder: undefined, // string, since 1.14.0
	maxPopupItems: 10, // int
	displaySecondaryValues: false, // boolean
	selectedKey: undefined, // string
	selectedItemId: undefined, // string
	searchHelpEnabled: false, // boolean
	searchHelpText: undefined, // string
	searchHelpAdditionalText: undefined, // string
	searchHelpIcon: undefined, // sap.ui.core.URI
	maxHistoryItems: 0, // int
	items: [], // sap.ui.core.ListItem
	myListBox: "", // sap.ui.commons.ListBox
	ariaDescribedBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	ariaLabelledBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	listBox: "", // sap.ui.commons.ListBox
	change: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this],
	liveChange: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this],
	searchHelp: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this]
})
Templates.helpDescription: The control provides a field that allows end users to an entry out of a list of pre-defined items. The choosable items can be provided in the form of a complete ListBox, single ListItems.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.DropdownBox

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.21.0 Please use the control sap.ui.unified.FileUploader of the library sap.ui.unified instead.
The framework generates an input field and a button with text "Browse ...". The API supports features such as on change uploads (the upload starts immediately after a file has been selected), file uploads with explicit calls, adjustable control sizes, text display after uploads, or tooltips containing complete file paths.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.FileUploader

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.21.0 Please use the element sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderParameter of the library sap.ui.unified instead.
Represents a parameter for the FileUploader which is rendered as a hidden inputfield.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.FileUploaderParameter

Templates.helpDescription: Allows to use a limited set of HTML tags for display
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.FormattedTextView

Templates.helpDescription: Divides the screen in visual areas.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.HorizontalDivider

Templates.helpDescription:
A wrapper around the IMG tag. The image can be loaded from a remote or local server.
There are various size setting options available, and the images can be combined with actions.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Image

Templates.helpDescription: Combination of image areas where at runtime these areas are starting points for hyperlinks or actions
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.ImageMap

Templates.helpDescription: The InPlaceEdit is a functionality to have text in display mode that can be changed in place.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.InPlaceEdit

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.Label({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	design: sap.ui.commons.LabelDesign.Standard, // sap.ui.commons.LabelDesign
	textDirection: sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit, // sap.ui.core.TextDirection
	wrapping: false, // boolean
	width: "", // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	text: "", // string
	icon: undefined, // sap.ui.core.URI
	textAlign: sap.ui.core.TextAlign.Begin, // sap.ui.core.TextAlign
	required: false, // boolean, since 1.11.0
	requiredAtBegin: undefined, // boolean, since 1.14.0
	labelFor: "" // sap.ui.core.Control
})
Templates.helpDescription: Is used for labeling other controls. The API provides formatting options, for example for bold display or alignment. A label can have an icon.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Label

Templates.helpDescription:
Provides an absolute or relative reference to an internal or external URL. The classical target parameters are supported.
Another usage scenario is triggering an action, for example to open a popup window. In both cases, the link is a hypertext link.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Link

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.ListBox({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	editable: true, // boolean
	enabled: true, // boolean
	allowMultiSelect: false, // boolean
	width: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	height: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	scrollTop: -1, // int
	displayIcons: false, // boolean
	displaySecondaryValues: false, // boolean
	valueTextAlign: sap.ui.core.TextAlign.Begin, // sap.ui.core.TextAlign
	secondaryValueTextAlign: sap.ui.core.TextAlign.Begin, // sap.ui.core.TextAlign
	minWidth: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	maxWidth: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	visibleItems: undefined, // int
	items: [], // sap.ui.core.Item
	ariaDescribedBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	ariaLabelledBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	select: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this]
})
Templates.helpDescription:
Provides a list of items from which users can choose an item. For the design of the list box, features such as defining the list box height,
fixing the number of visible items, choosing one item to be the item that is marked by default when the list box is shown, or a scroll bar for large list boxes
are available.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.ListBox

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.21.0 Please use the control sap.ui.unified.Menu of the library sap.ui.unified instead.
A container for menu items. When the space in the browser is not large enough to display all defined items, a scroll bar is provided.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Menu

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.MenuBar({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	enabled: true, // boolean
	width: "100%", // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	design: sap.ui.commons.MenuBarDesign.Standard, // sap.ui.commons.MenuBarDesign
	items: [] // sap.ui.unified.MenuItem
})
Templates.helpDescription:
Represents a user interface area which is the entry point for menus with their menu items. MenuBar is useful for applications which shall offer a
set of actions that shall be provided in a structured way. The MenuBar contains the menu titles from where users navigate to the single items. The control supports
for example long menu item texts, automated scrolling for menu items when the browser space is not large enough to display all items, defining images for single
or all items in a menu, automated layouting of items with or w/o image, and active/non-active items.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.MenuBar

Templates.helpDescription:
Common button control that opens a menu when clicked by the user. The control provides an API for configuring the docking position
of the menu.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.MenuButton

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.21.0 Please use the control sap.ui.unified.MenuItem of the library sap.ui.unified instead.
Smallest unit in the menu hierarchy. An item can be a direct part of a menu bar, of a menu, or of a sub menu.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.MenuItem

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.21.0 Please use the control sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase of the library sap.ui.unified instead.
Provides the standard properties for menu items.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.MenuItemBase

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.21.0 Please use the control sap.ui.unified.MenuTextFieldItem of the library sap.ui.unified instead.
Menu item which contains an text field. This menu item is e.g. helpful for filters. The aggregation 'submenu' (inherited from parent class) is not supported for this type of menu item.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.MenuTextFieldItem

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.Message({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	type: undefined, // sap.ui.commons.MessageType
	text: undefined, // string
	associatedElementId: undefined, // string
	design: undefined // string
})
Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.4.0 A new messaging concept will be created in future. Therefore this control might be removed in one of the next versions.
Creates the "Message"s to be supplied to the "MessageBar" Control.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Message

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.MessageBar({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	anchorID: "", // string
	visible: true, // boolean
	maxToasted: 3, // int
	maxListed: 7, // int
	anchorSnapPoint: begin top // string
})
Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.4.0 A new messaging concept will be created in future. Therefore this control might be removed in one of the next versions.
Creates an instance of a "MessageBar" Control, for displaying "Message"s. There is no imposed limit on the number of "MessageBar"s that can be created, but using only 1 makes sense, specially if accessing it (via Ctl-m) becomes a necessity.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBar

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.4.0 A new messaging concept will be created in future. Therefore this control might be removed in one of the next versions.
Instantiated by the "MessageBar" Control if the user ever requests to generate the corresponding "MessageList".
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageList

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.4.0 A new messaging concept will be created in future. Therefore this control might be removed in one of the next versions.
Responsible for displaying the new incoming messages, one at the time, on top of the MessageBar.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageToast

Templates.helpDescription: Provides navigation between pages within a list of numbered pages.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Paginator

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.Panel({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	width: "100%", // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	height: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	enabled: true, // boolean
	scrollLeft: 0, // int
	scrollTop: 0, // int
	applyContentPadding: true, // boolean
	collapsed: false, // boolean
	areaDesign: sap.ui.commons.enums.AreaDesign.Fill, // sap.ui.commons.enums.AreaDesign
	borderDesign: sap.ui.commons.enums.BorderDesign.Box, // sap.ui.commons.enums.BorderDesign
	showCollapseIcon: true, // boolean
	text: undefined, // string
	content: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	title: "", // sap.ui.core.Title
	buttons: [] // sap.ui.commons.Button
})
Templates.helpDescription: Represents a container with scroll functionality, the control can be used for text and controls. The Panel does not layout the embedded controls.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Panel

Templates.helpDescription: A text field with masked characters which borrows its properties and methods from TextField.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.PasswordField

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.ProgressIndicator({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	enabled: true, // boolean
	barColor: sap.ui.core.BarColor.NEUTRAL, // sap.ui.core.BarColor
	displayValue: 0%, // string
	percentValue: 0, // int
	showValue: true, // boolean
	width: "100%" // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
})
Templates.helpDescription:
Shows the progress of a process in a graphical way. The indicator can be displayed with or without numerical values.
The filling can be displayed in color only, or additionally with the percentage rate. The indicator status can be interactive.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.ProgressIndicator

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.RadioButton({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	text: undefined, // string
	enabled: true, // boolean
	editable: true, // boolean
	selected: false, // boolean
	valueState: sap.ui.core.ValueState.None, // sap.ui.core.ValueState
	width: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	textDirection: sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit, // sap.ui.core.TextDirection
	groupName: sapUiRbDefaultGroup, // string
	key: undefined, // string
	ariaDescribedBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	ariaLabelledBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	select: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this]
})
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.RadioButton

Templates.helpDescription: a group of RadioButtons to hande as one UI element.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.RadioButtonGroup

Templates.helpDescription:
The interactive control is displayed either as a horizontal or a vertical line with two pointers and units of measurement.
Users can move the pointers along the line to change a range with graphical support.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.RangeSlider

Templates.helpDescription:
Is used to let the user do some rating on a certain topic. The amount of rating symbols can be specified, as well as the URIs to the
image icons which shall be used as rating symbols. When the user performs a rating, an event is fired.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.RatingIndicator

Templates.helpDescription: Is used to provide a container, which can show different content depending on its current width. It fires an event, whenever a new range is reached. In addition the content of the new range is automatically shown, if it is set.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainer

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainerRange({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	width: "", // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	height: "", // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	key: "", // string
	content: "" // sap.ui.core.Control
})
Templates.helpDescription: Defines a range for the ResponsiveContainer
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainerRange

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.RichTooltip({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	title: undefined, // string
	imageSrc: undefined, // sap.ui.core.URI
	valueStateText: undefined, // string, since 1.11.1
	imageAltText: undefined, // string, since 1.11.1
	formattedText: "", // sap.ui.commons.FormattedTextView
	individualStateText: "" // sap.ui.commons.FormattedTextView
})
Templates.helpDescription: Is used to provide tool tips that can have long text, image and title. This tool tip extends the TooltipBase.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.RichTooltip

Templates.helpDescription: Is used to display step-by-step work flows of a clearly defined work process
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.RoadMap

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.RoadMapStep({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	label: undefined, // string
	enabled: true, // boolean
	expanded: false, // boolean
	visible: true, // boolean
	subSteps: [] // sap.ui.commons.RoadMapStep
})
Templates.helpDescription: Step used within a RoadMap Control.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.RoadMapStep

Templates.helpDescription: This control displays items in a stacked list format, allowing the user to page in order to see more items or to use the offered filtering and sorting capabilities in order to manipulate the displayed data.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.RowRepeater

Templates.helpDescription: This element is used by the RowRepeater and allows to define a filter in this context along with the related data such as a text and an icon.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.RowRepeaterFilter

Templates.helpDescription: This element is used by the RowRepeater and allows to define a sorter in this context along with the related data such as a text and an icon.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.RowRepeaterSorter

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.SearchField({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	enableListSuggest: true, // boolean
	showListExpander: true, // boolean
	enableClear: false, // boolean
	showExternalButton: false, // boolean
	enableCache: true, // boolean, since 1.10.3
	enableFilterMode: false, // boolean
	value: "", // string
	enabled: true, // boolean
	editable: true, // boolean
	width: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	maxLength: 0, // int
	textAlign: sap.ui.core.TextAlign.Begin, // sap.ui.core.TextAlign
	visibleItemCount: 20, // int
	startSuggestion: 3, // int
	maxSuggestionItems: 10, // int
	maxHistoryItems: 0, // int
	searchProvider: "", // sap.ui.core.search.SearchProvider
	ariaDescribedBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	ariaLabelledBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	search: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this],
	suggest: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this]
})
Templates.helpDescription: Allows the user to type search queries and to trigger the search. Optionally, suggestions can be added.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.SearchField

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.6.0 Replaced by sap.ui.core.search.OpenSearchProvider
A SearchProvider which can be attached to a Search Field.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.SearchProvider

Templates.helpDescription: The SegmentedButton provides a group of multiple buttons. Only one button can be active. The behaviour is more ore less like a radio button group.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.SegmentedButton

Templates.helpDescription:
The interactive control is displayed either as a horizontal or a vertical line with a pointer and units of measurement.
Users can move the pointer along the line to change values with graphical support.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Slider

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.Splitter({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	splitterOrientation: sap.ui.core.Orientation.Vertical, // sap.ui.core.Orientation
	splitterPosition: sap.ui.core.Percentage.50%, // sap.ui.core.Percentage
	minSizeFirstPane: sap.ui.core.Percentage.0%, // sap.ui.core.Percentage
	minSizeSecondPane: sap.ui.core.Percentage.0%, // sap.ui.core.Percentage
	width: sap.ui.commons.SplitterSize.100%, // sap.ui.commons.SplitterSize
	height: sap.ui.commons.SplitterSize.100%, // sap.ui.commons.SplitterSize
	showScrollBars: true, // boolean
	splitterBarVisible: true, // boolean
	firstPaneContent: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	secondPaneContent: [] // sap.ui.core.Control
})
Templates.helpDescription: Allows to split the screen into two areas. Make sure that the container for the splitter has an absolute height or set an absolute height for the splitter using the height property. Otherwise the height of the splitter is calculated by the height of its contents.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Splitter

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.Tab({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	width: "100%", // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	height: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	enabled: true, // boolean
	scrollLeft: 0, // int
	scrollTop: 0, // int
	applyContentPadding: true, // boolean
	collapsed: false, // boolean
	areaDesign: sap.ui.commons.enums.AreaDesign.Fill, // sap.ui.commons.enums.AreaDesign
	borderDesign: sap.ui.commons.enums.BorderDesign.Box, // sap.ui.commons.enums.BorderDesign
	showCollapseIcon: true, // boolean
	text: undefined, // string
	verticalScrolling: sap.ui.core.Scrolling.None, // sap.ui.core.Scrolling
	horizontalScrolling: sap.ui.core.Scrolling.None, // sap.ui.core.Scrolling
	closable: false, // boolean
	selected: false, // boolean
	content: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	title: "", // sap.ui.core.Title
	buttons: [] // sap.ui.commons.Button
})
Templates.helpDescription: A single page in a TabStrip control.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Tab

Templates.helpDescription: A container for tab controls which contain the content and generally other controls. The user switches between the tabs then to display the content.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.TabStrip

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.TextArea({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	value: "", // string
	textDirection: sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit, // sap.ui.core.TextDirection
	enabled: true, // boolean
	editable: true, // boolean
	required: false, // boolean
	width: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	maxLength: 0, // int
	valueState: sap.ui.core.ValueState.None, // sap.ui.core.ValueState
	textAlign: sap.ui.core.TextAlign.Begin, // sap.ui.core.TextAlign
	imeMode: sap.ui.core.ImeMode.Auto, // sap.ui.core.ImeMode
	design: sap.ui.core.Design.Standard, // sap.ui.core.Design
	helpId: "", // string
	accessibleRole: sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole.Textbox, // sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole
	name: undefined, // string
	placeholder: undefined, // string, since 1.14.0
	height: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	cols: undefined, // int
	rows: undefined, // int
	wrapping: undefined, // sap.ui.core.Wrapping
	cursorPos: undefined, // int
	explanation: undefined, // string
	labeledBy: undefined, // string
	ariaDescribedBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	ariaLabelledBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	change: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this],
	liveChange: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this]
})
Templates.helpDescription: Control to enter or display multible row text.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.TextArea

Templates.helpDescription: Renders a input field for text input.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.TextField

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.TextView({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	text: "", // string
	textDirection: sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit, // sap.ui.core.TextDirection
	enabled: true, // boolean
	helpId: "", // string
	accessibleRole: sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole.Document, // sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole
	design: sap.ui.commons.TextViewDesign.Standard, // sap.ui.commons.TextViewDesign
	wrapping: true, // boolean

	textAlign: sap.ui.core.TextAlign.Begin, // sap.ui.core.TextAlign
	width: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	ariaDescribedBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	ariaLabelledBy: [] // sap.ui.core.Control
})
Templates.helpDescription: Is used to display some continous text. The control can inherit the text direction from its parent control.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.TextView

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 moved to sap.ui.core library. Please use this one.
Represents a title element that can be used for aggregation with other controls
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Title

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.ToggleButton({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	text: "", // string
	enabled: true, // boolean
	width: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	helpId: "", // string
	icon: "", // sap.ui.core.URI
	iconHovered: "", // sap.ui.core.URI
	iconSelected: "", // sap.ui.core.URI
	iconFirst: true, // boolean
	height: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	styled: true, // boolean
	lite: false, // boolean
	style: sap.ui.commons.ButtonStyle.Default, // sap.ui.commons.ButtonStyle
	pressed: false, // boolean
	ariaDescribedBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	ariaLabelledBy: [], // sap.ui.core.Control
	press: [function (oEvent) {
		var control = oEvent.getSource();
	}, this]
})
Templates.helpDescription: The ToggleButton Control is a Button that can be toggled between pressed and normal state
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.ToggleButton

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.Toolbar({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	width: "auto", // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	design: sap.ui.commons.ToolbarDesign.Flat, // sap.ui.commons.ToolbarDesign
	standalone: true, // boolean
	items: [], // sap.ui.commons.ToolbarItem
	rightItems: [] // sap.ui.commons.ToolbarItem
})
Templates.helpDescription:
A horizontal row of items where in many cases the single toolbar items are buttons containing icons. Note that all controls with the
sap.ui.commons.ToolbarItem interface can be used as item: Button, ComboBox, TextField.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Toolbar

Templates.helpDescription: A small vertical line that is generally added to the tool bar between the items to visually separate them.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.ToolbarSeparator

Templates.helpDescription: Simple tree to display item in a hierarchical way
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.Tree

Templates.helpDescription: Tree node element
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.TreeNode

Templates.helpDescription:
TriStateCheckBox to reflect mixed state for checkboxes. The control can display three states, namely checked, unchecked and mixed. However, mixed state cannot be directly reached by user interaction on the particular control.
It can be only set by the control's public toggle function, to make a behaviour possible which is e.g. required in checkbox trees.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBox

Templates.helpDescription: A TextField with an attached icon which triggeres an event.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.ValueHelpField

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 moved to sap.ui.layout library. Please use this one.
Form control. Holder for form control to be rendered in a specific form layout. A Form supports VariantLayoutData for it's conent to allow a simple switching of Layouts.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.form.Form

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 moved to sap.ui.layout library. Please use this one.
Used to group form elements.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.form.FormContainer

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 moved to sap.ui.layout library. Please use this one.
A form element is a combination of one label and different controls associated to this label.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.form.FormElement

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 moved to sap.ui.layout library. Please use this one.
Base layout for Forms. Other Layouts must inherit from this one.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.form.FormLayout

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 moved to sap.ui.layout library. Please use this one.
Grid layout specific properties for FormContainers. The width and height properties of the elements are ignored since the witdh and heights are defined by the grid cells.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.form.GridContainerData

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 moved to sap.ui.layout library. Please use this one.
The grid specific layout data for FormElement fields. The width property of the elements is ignored since the width is defined by grid cells.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.form.GridElementData

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 moved to sap.ui.layout library. Please use this one.
This Layout implements a guideline 2.0 grid. This can be a 16 column grid or an 8 column grid. To adjust the content inside the GridLayout GridContainerData and GridElementData could be used.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.form.GridLayout

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 moved to sap.ui.layout library. Please use this one.
Renders a form with responsive layout. Internally the ResponsiveFlowLayout is used.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.form.ResponsiveLayout

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 moved to sap.ui.layout library. Please use this one.
Use the SimpleForm to create a form based on title, label and fields that are stacked in the content aggregation. Add Title to start a new FormContainer(Group). Add Label to start a new row in the container. Add Input/Display controls as needed. Use LayoutData to influence the layout for special cases in the Input/Display controls.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.form.SimpleForm

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.layout.AbsoluteLayout({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	width: "100%", // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	height: "100%", // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	verticalScrolling: sap.ui.core.Scrolling.Hidden, // sap.ui.core.Scrolling
	horizontalScrolling: sap.ui.core.Scrolling.Hidden, // sap.ui.core.Scrolling
	positions: [] // sap.ui.commons.layout.PositionContainer
})
Templates.helpDescription: The Absolute Layout positions its child controls absolutely
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.AbsoluteLayout

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayout({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	rtl: false, // boolean
	width: "100%", // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	height: "100%", // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	top: "", // sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
	begin: "", // sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
	center: "", // sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
	end: "", // sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
	bottom: "" // sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
})
Templates.helpDescription:
Based upon the border layout as it comes with the Java standard. Using this layout, you are able to divide your available UI space into five areas whose sizes can be defined. These areas are: Top: Header; Bottom: Footer; Begin: Left/right-hand side panel; Center: Content area
in the middle; End: Right/left-hand side panel.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayout

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	areaId: sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutAreaTypes.top, // sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutAreaTypes
	overflowX: auto, // string
	overflowY: auto, // string
	contentAlign: left, // string
	size: "100px", // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	visible: true, // boolean
	content: [] // sap.ui.core.Control
})
Templates.helpDescription: The BorderLayoutArea represents one area of a BorderLayout
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea

Templates.helpDescription: A layout that provides support for horizontal alignment of controls
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.HorizontalLayout

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayout({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	width: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	height: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	layoutFixed: true, // boolean
	columns: undefined, // int
	widths: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize[]
	rows: [] // sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutRow
})
Templates.helpDescription:
A matrix layout arranges controls in a grid structure, using rows which need not have the same number of cells.

It uses predefined cell classes that guarantee appropriate distances between cells in the grid. The cell's vGutter property lets you specify additional horizontal distances easily. You can set these additional distances (known as gutters) with or without separators. The distance for each cell is specified by assigning a specific enumeration value of the class LayoutCellSeparator of the matrix data object.

You should avoid nesting matrix layouts. You should only use a matrix layout if you need to align controls horizontally across rows.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayout

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutCell({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	backgroundDesign: sap.ui.commons.layout.BackgroundDesign.Transparent, // sap.ui.commons.layout.BackgroundDesign
	colSpan: 1, // int
	hAlign: sap.ui.commons.layout.HAlign.Begin, // sap.ui.commons.layout.HAlign
	padding: sap.ui.commons.layout.Padding.End, // sap.ui.commons.layout.Padding
	rowSpan: 1, // int
	separation: sap.ui.commons.layout.Separation.None, // sap.ui.commons.layout.Separation
	vAlign: sap.ui.commons.layout.VAlign.Middle, // sap.ui.commons.layout.VAlign
	content: [] // sap.ui.core.Control
})
Templates.helpDescription: Non-control element used as part of a matrix layout's inner structure.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutCell

Templates.helpDescription: Non-control element used as part of a matrix layout's inner structure.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutRow

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.commons.layout.PositionContainer({
	id: "${id}", // sap.ui.core.ID
	top: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	bottom: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	left: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	right: undefined, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
	centerHorizontally: false, // boolean
	centerVertically: false, // boolean
	control: "" // sap.ui.core.Control
})
Templates.helpDescription: Is used to specify the position of a control in the AbsoluteLayout
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.PositionContainer

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 moved to sap.ui.layout library. Please use this one.
This is a layout where several controls can be added. These controls are blown up to fit a whole line. If the window resizes the controls are moved between the lines and resized again.
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.ResponsiveFlowLayout

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 moved to sap.ui.layout library. Please use this one.
This is a LayoutData Element that can be added to a control if this control is used within a ResponsiveFlowLayout
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.ResponsiveFlowLayoutData

Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 Moved to sap.ui.layout library. Please use this one.
In this layout the elemnts are orderd one below the other
Templates.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.VerticalLayout
